page.title: 18HISTORY: DANE END & AREA
page.content: Much of the D-block is in the parish of {LITTLE MUNDEN.}This name is derived from Munda, an Anglo-Saxon personal name, and denu, valley - Munda's valley.{ALL SAINTS CHURCH} contains the 14th Century tombs of the Thornbury family. { POTTER'S GREEN}was in the 12th Century noted for pottery. Broken clay pottery can still be found. The{BLACKSMITHS FORGE}in Dane End dates back to the 17th Century and{The {Boot}public house dates back to the 18th Century. {ANCIENT ROADS:}The oldest road in use is the Roman highway from Verulamium to Braughing which runs through the D-block. The ancient King's Highway from Buntingford to Hertford runs through Dane End.The 'Causey' from Ware once joined a Stevenage to Stortford road at Rowney Priory.
